vtkplotmesh.cpp File Reference

plot polygon mesh More...

Detailed Description

plot polygon mesh

[triangulation] = vtkplotmesh([HANDLE], vertices, [faces], [vertexLabels], [colors], [config, ...])

Parameters:
[in] HANDLE (optional) explicit VTK handle
[in] vertices a list of points (see Points)
[in] faces (optional) triangulation matrix Nx3, containing the vertex indices
[in] vertexLabels (optional) list of labels (same length as vertices).
[in] colors (optional) a color LUT for the labels (see Color Lookup Tables)
[in] config (optional) config structure (see Configuration parameters)
[out] triangulation triangle vertex indeces, same format as faces
In the simplest call form, vtkplotmesh takes a vertex list and triangulates it to a meshgrid. The result of the triangulation is returned as output value.

Triangulation
The Delaunay triangulation can be steered by to parameters in the config struct:
triangulationTolerance: control discarding of closely spaced points. This tolerance is specified as a fraction of the diagonal length of the bounding box of the points.
triangulationAlpha: For a non-zero alpha value, only edges, faces, or tetra contained within the circumsphere (of radius alpha) will be output.
If the function is called with a faces argument, the triangulation is taken from that list.

The labels vector can be used, to assign labels to vertices. The vertices are colored accordingly and color is interpolated over the polygons. When no color is specified, a default jet colormap is used. Otherwise, the colors for the labels are taken from the color LUT.
